[b][color=white]HF API v1 Beta[/color][/b]
After receiving feedback on the original API that was released to R3KT members to test out, Omniscient and Meshcollider have revamped the API to be RESTful friendly and included the key in the authentication header. Read the source thread for more about the progress made and its future. [i][size=x-small][url=https://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5662721] >>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]No Longer Closing Inactive Accounts[/color][/b]
Omniscient announced that he will no longer close inactive accounts as it was not worth it and a hassle to close those accounts. Members who take a long inactivity leave from Hack Forums can now return with their account still open. He also is considering reopening the accounts (L33t & Ub3r only) that were closed due to inactivity.[i][size=x-small][url=https://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5659792] >>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[list][b][color=white][u]Announcement Threads[/u][/color][/b]


[list][url=https://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5659792][b]"Closing Inactive Accounts"[/b][/url] - [url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1][b][color=#FF66FF]Omniscient[/color][/b][/url]
Omniscient has announced the official ending of the inactive account closure policy. He states that he is considering to open L33t/Ub3r members that were once closed.[/list]
[/list]

[list][b][color=white][u]Informational Threads[/u][/color][/b]
[list]

[url=https://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5656038][b]"[Informational] Patronymic Patterns"[/b][/url] - [url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1073426][b][color=#00AAFF]Aces.[/color][/b][/url]
A concise and informational thread on Patronymic patterns. If you master this, you will be able to guess a person's origin from their last name![/list]
[list]

[url=https://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5657686][b]"[Consensus] Arbitraging Crypto Currencies"[/b][/url] - [url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=3323516][b][color=white]Trappy[/color][/b][/url]
An extremely informational thread describing and explaining what "arbitrage" is, and how it works.[/list]
[list]

[url=https://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5652639][b]"Coinbase is Shady"[/b][/url] - [url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1][b][color=#FF66FF]Omniscient[/color][/b][/url]
Can Coinbase be trusted with such a large amount of users? Have they been stopping exchanges and blocks whenever they wanted to? Omniscient displays his own opinion in this thread.[/list]
[/list]

[color=1E90FF][size=large][font=Monotype Corsiva]Interview[/font][/size][/color] [color=white][size=large][font=Monotype Corsiva]-[/font][/size][/color] [size=large][font=Monotype Corsiva][url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=767395]01001[/url][/font][/size][spoiler=][align=left]

[hr]

[url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=692131][color=#f4909e][b]Tsundere[/b][/color][/url]: Hello and welcome to the 350 edition of the Hack Forums News. Today we have the lovely member, 01001. Would you like to give any shoutouts before we begin?
[url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=767395][color=white][b]01001[/b][/color][/url]: Hello, before Inception I'd like to thank you for associating me with this edition. Sweet shoutouts to Tsundere, iHydra, and the entire Hack Forums News Team!

[url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=692131][color=#f4909e][b]Tsundere[/b][/color][/url]: We are nearing 400 editions. A huge accomplishment for the Hack Forums News Team. I was wondering how long have you been a part of the team? Any special moments you remember that made your HFNT experience more enjoyable?
[url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=767395][color=white][b]01001[/b][/color][/url]: Indeed. A great accomplishment, it wouldn't be possible without iHydra, since he led the team effectively. It shouldn't be a surprise for you that I joined HFNT when we published our 300th edition. Earlier, i used to write/publish sections, which I still do. There are no special moments, but special relationship that I build with this team. I was a naive user when I joined HFNT, yet, team used to appreciate me for my efforts. HFNT made my each and every moment special!

[url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=692131][color=#f4909e][b]Tsundere[/b][/color][/url]: That's good to know how much you love the team. You've been a member of Hack Forums since 2011. A lot has changed. People have come and gone many sites changes implemented. What is your current opinion on the state of Hack Forums?
[url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=767395][color=white][b]01001[/b][/color][/url]: A great website, which has a lot to offer whether it's knowledge or entrepreneurship. Though, I'm still confused with the awards system. Since a lot of users purchase awards in order to look HQ and generous, but I believe their donation is not really helping anyone. Helping the site owner to run the servers is a good thing but there are ample of users who donate on daily basis, which is enough to run this site for years.  There should be a way, where users can donate some money to NGO's or foundations which are literally helping someone. Hack Forums must add an option, where you donate some money to NGO's and get an award. By this they'll surely look HQ and generous. P.S.: I'm not disparaging anyone nor the HF since it's doing great. It's my opinion along with a suggestion.

[url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=692131][color=#f4909e][b]Tsundere[/b][/color][/url]: Interesting way to view the award system. Now, in addition to being a member for so long, you have also had the chance to open up a few services on the site over the years. Could you go into detail on some of the things you've done?
[url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=767395][color=white][b]01001[/b][/color][/url]: Thank you! As far as my services are concerned, I'm very fanatic about whatever I do or get to know. There was a time when I didn't know what SEO is, I did an intensive research on it and thought that it's a great way to share my skills. Currently, I offer SEO Service and SEO Mentoring, where I teach SEO on hourly basis. Besides, I also offer quality Writing Service. I believe that everyone deserves a chance to avail quality service at an affordable price.

[url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=692131][color=#f4909e][b]Tsundere[/b][/color][/url]: In a short and simple way, would you be able to describe what SEO services means to those who have no idea what it is?
[url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=767395][color=white][b]01001[/b][/color][/url]: SEO stands for Search Engine Optimization. Where we work on a website to make sure whether it's following Google policies or not. Likewise, we work on it's content and relevant Keywords to help the website show up in Search Engine. People who are running online businesses and are not getting sales/clients because of their competitors. This is where we step in and help you to rank up your website against your competition.

[url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=692131][color=#f4909e][b]Tsundere[/b][/color][/url]: You are currently running your own website, correct? Do you use your knowledge in SEO to get traffic to your website? Also, feel free to plug your website and let the readers know more about it.
[url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=767395][color=white][b]01001[/b][/color][/url]: Yes, I'm running a News/Digital Media website called Virtuefy (http://www.virtuefy.com/) and I know how to write catchy and SEO optimized content in order to entice the audience. Virtuefy is not another brick in the wall, unlike other News/Media websites. Virtuefy deals with quality content that might be useful for others. Irrespective of any specific niche, this site has various categories such as Fashion, Lifestyle, Technology etc. I'm also thinking to launch it's mobile APP and a product that justifies the name Virtuefy!

[url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=692131][color=#f4909e][b]Tsundere[/b][/color][/url]: That's really awesome Mr. Binary Man. What makes you so interested in these topics? For those unaware, you are mostly the writer for the Tech News part of the HF News. What motivates you to keep writing about this specific topic?
[url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=767395][color=white][b]01001[/b][/color][/url]: Being an aquarian, you can call me a dreamer but I feel that Virtuefy will do wonders in future. It could be a product, project or maybe a News/Media but I have high hopes. And writing Tech News keeps me updated with the Technology and keeps on reminding me that "Yes, I'm born to do something great." It's not merely a writing/publishing, but a great way to keep us updated in this fast pace of life.

[url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=692131][color=#f4909e][b]Tsundere[/b][/color][/url]: Well, I hope that you can keep that dream alive and continue doing what you love. That is all we have today for this interview. Any words of wisdom you would like to share?
[url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=767395][color=white][b]01001[/b][/color][/url]: Thank you, and I've a very simple philosophy or we better call it my adage. "We all are dreaming is the dusk, but the dawn awaits."  Thank you for showing your scrupulous demeanor while conducting this interview!
[/align][/spoiler][/align]

[hr]

[b][color=white]Podcast Update[/color][/b]
A few changes will be made in the next week or so to fix the structure of how the Podcast works currently. I'll keep everyone updated on the progress. Sorry for the delay, this needs to get done to have a smooth and consistent podcast running.

[color=transparent]       [/color]

[align=center][img]https://i.imgur.com/x67jYMw.png[/img][/align]

[b][color=white]Cocoa and Chocolate Help Improve Your Cognition[/color][/b] 
In a recent review published in Frontiers in Nutrition, Italian researchers have examined what happens to your brain up to a few hours after you eat cocoa flavanols, and what happens when you sustain such a rich cocoa flavanol diet.  Many participants showed in tests that, among others, enhancements in working memory performance, and improved visual information processing after digesting cocoa. For women there were, even more, benefits, eating cocoa after a night of sleep deprivation actually counteracted the cognitive impairment. Lots of promising results for those that suffer from chronic sleep deprivation or those that work long work shifts. Valentina Socci and Michele Ferrara from the University of L'Aquila in Italy notes: "This result suggests the potential of cocoa flavanols to protect cognition in vulnerable populations over time by improving cognitive performance. If you look at the underlying mechanism, the cocoa flavanols have beneficial effects for cardiovascular health and can increase cerebral blood volume in the dentate gyrus of the hippocampus. This structure is particularly affected by ageing and therefore the potential source of age-related memory decline in humans." So to summarise, add a little chocolate to your diet, as long as it's within good moderation.[i][size=x-small][url=https://www.sciencedaily.com/releases/2017/06/170629101648.htm]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]UK to end International Fishing Agreement[/color][/b] 
The UK government is about to end an agreement that allows other countries to fish within UK waters. The original agreement allows Irish, Dutch, French, German, and Belgian vessels to fish within six and 12 nautical miles of UK coastline. Environment Secretary Michael Gove said that the move would help the UK to take back the control of fishing within the UK waters. Michael Creed, Ireland's Minister for Agriculture, has said that it "was unwelcome and unhelpful." "Brexit poses very serious challenges to the seafood sector and this announcement will form part of the negotiations," he said. The Scottish government, however, has backed the idea saying it had been pressing for this for some time. The original agreement was signed in 1964 before the UK joined what became the UK. Official figures say fishing contributed to £604m to UK GDP in 2015 and employed around 12,000 fishers. By withdrawing from the agreement, they hope that this can only rise giving more space to UK based fishers and a larger area to fish from with undisturbed waters.  [i][size=x-small][url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-40471466]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]Study Shows That Engaging in Simple Expressions of Judgment-Free Art, Such as Drawing, Activates the Brain’s Reward Pathways.[/color][/b] 
A new study published in The Arts in Psychotherapy finds that if you engage in judgement-free art, such as drawing, doodling, coloring, and more, it activates the brain's reward pathways leading to improvements in health and well-being. This particular study is the first to examine brain activation via functional near-infrared spectroscopy (fNIRS). Participants of 11 men, 15 women; 8 being artists and 16 non-artists, engaged in sperate tasks in equal intervals to test the theory. Additional data were collected by a pre- and post-survey of the participants self-perceptions of creativity and prior experience with drawing tasks. Overall, the three main tasks of drawing, doodling, and coloring all resulted in significant activation of the medial prefrontal cortex. Doodling was the winner though, as it resulted in the maximum activation of the medial prefrontal cortex compared to coloring and free drawing. [i][size=x-small][url=http://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S019745561630171X]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]


[color=transparent]   [/color]

[align=center][img]https://i.imgur.com/vBnTpNT.png[/img][/align]

[b][color=white]Trump Travel Ban Finally Comes Into Effect[/color][/b] 
Six countries, mainly Muslim, now face much tougher entry into the US due to President Donald Trump's new travel ban. This means that without "close" family or business relations in the US, many people could be denied a visa and barred entry. Lawyers have taken up positions at some US airports to offer free advice for those affected. The ban does not affect those already in the country, so those with a valid visa or green cards are still free to travel. To potentially enter you must have a close relationship with someone in the US, such as a parent, child or sibling, and in the last minute change, a spouse. However, grandparents, aunts, uncles nephews or nieces are not considered to be "close" relations.  The countries affected by this ban are Iran, Libya, Syria, Somalia, Sudan, and Yemen. The ban also extends to all current refugees. The policy was originally left in limbo after it was struck down by federal judges in Hawaii and Maryland but was reinstated by the supreme court who upheld Trump's ban. [i][size=x-small][url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-us-canada-40452360]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]Almost 500,000 Refugees Return Home in 2017[/color][/b] 
A large number of Syrian refugees, believed to be totaling close to 500,000 have returned home this year, the United Nations has said, describing this as a "notable trend". More than 440,000 internally displaced Syrians and around 31,000 of those who have fled abroad have now returned to their homes the UN refugee agency (UNHCR) has said. The UN warns that the conditions for a safe return "are not in place".  The return home has been described as very "spontaneous" by UNHCR spokesman Andrej Mahecic who went on to say "Most of these people are returning to check on their properties, to find out about the family members. This is what we know from some of the evidence that we have gathered. In some cases, they have their own perceptions about the security, whether they are real or perceived improvements in the security situation in the areas where they are going to." More than 300,000 Syrians have lost their lives during the Syrian War, which began with anti-government protests. [i][size=x-small][url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-middle-east-40460126]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]Germany Approves Gay Marriage[/color][/b] 
During a snap vote, a clear majority of German MPs have voted to legalize same-sex marriage, only days after Chancellor Angela Merkel dropped her opposition to a vote. The vote now allows same-sex couples full martial rights, and also allows them to adopt children. Angela Merkel's opposition was strongly for the vote, but Merkel herself actually voted against. The bill was backed by 393 lawmakers, 226 voted against, and four abstained. The German legal code for marriage will now read: "Marriage is entered into for life by two people of different or the same sex". Merkel has previously admitted to having a "hard time" with the issue arguing against gay marriage due to "children's welfare," but regardless of her own views, she pushed the issue to a free vote in which the bill was passed. After the vote, Merkel has said she hoped the passing of the bill will lead to more "social cohesion and peace".  [i][size=x-small][url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-europe-40441712]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[color=transparent]    [/color]

[align=center][img]https://i.imgur.com/Jvg81mQ.png[/img][/align]

[b][color=white]Apple Cuts iPhone Prices in India by up to 7.5%[/color][/b]
Apple has sliced direct costs of all its iPhone models by 4 percent to 7.5 percent from July 1, as the Cupertino-based cell phone maker passed on benefits accumulated from Goods and Services Tax (GST) administration to customers. 
As indicated by changes in costs on the organization's site on Saturday, the priciest iPhone 7 Plus with a 256 GB storage which was charged to purchasers for Rs 92,000, will now leave a littler opening - of Rs 85,400. The iPhone 6s beginning variation of 32 GB will now be available for Rs 46,900, a discount of 6.2 percent. [i][size=x-small][url=http://www.gadgetsnow.com/tech-news/apple-cuts-iphone-prices-in-india-by-up-to-7-5/articleshow/59400980.cms]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]Facebook Launches 'Find Wi-Fi' Feature Globally[/color][/b]
Facebook has extended its "Find Wi-Fi" feature globally on both iOS and Android devices for its two billion users. The social media goliath had started testing a "Find Wi-Fi" alternative a year ago on mobile only for iOS users in select nations.
"We're beginning to roll out 'Find Wi-Fi' everywhere in the world on iPhone and Android. We launched it in a handful of countries last year and found it's not only helpful for people who are travelling or on-the-go, but especially useful in areas where cellular data is scarce," Alex Himel, Engineering Director at Facebook, wrote in a blog post late Friday. [i][size=x-small][url=http://www.gadgetsnow.com/tech-news/facebook-launchesfind-wi-fi-feature-globally/articleshow/59400759.cms]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]Twitter Working on Reducing Offensive Content and Fake News[/color][/b]
In the progressing fight against wild abuse on its platform, microblogging website Twitter is attempting to include another component that would give users a chance to hail tweets that contain deceiving, false or hurtful data, the media revealed. Twitter is still testing the element and if the update could resemble a tab showing up in a drop-down menu close by tweets.
The new tool may assist the organization, with more than 300 million monthly users, to withstand fake accounts, extremists that use the platform to enroll and even loathe regurgitating trolls that have debilitated women and minorities. [i][size=x-small][url=http://www.gadgetsnow.com/tech-news/twitter-working-on-reducing-offensive-content-and-fake-news/articleshow/59400639.cms]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]
[color=transparent]      [/color]

[align=center][img]https://hackforums.news/assets/v3/GamingNews/Tsundere.png[/img][/align]

[b][color=white]Watch Dogs 2 Update Adds Four Player Co-Op Next Week[/color][/b] 
This Independence day, you will have the chance to play with three buddies in an upcoming update for Watch Dogs 2. The update is planned to be released on July 4, of course, and the update is free to download. You are probably wondering, why would it not be free? The update was originally planned to be released as a DLC you needed to purchase in order to unlock the co-op feature, but thankfully the co-op feature will be released for free for everyone to have access to. Ubisoft still plans on releasing the DLC too for those interested. The co-op feature allows players to roam around San Francisco, California and give the option to participate in fun game modes as a team. Sadly you do not have the option to play the two-player mini-games, but you do have the option to invade other people's world as four. [i][size=x-small][url=http://www.pcgamer.com/watch-dogs-2-update-adds-four-player-co-op-next-week/]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]StarCraft: Remastered Will Release This August for $15[/color][/b] 
StarCraft is definitely one of the most popular and notable RTS game series.  Those who enjoyed the very first StarCraft game or those willing to try out the original have the chance to pre-order a remastered version today. Blizzard proudly states that the game will include 4k graphics, audio improvement, and will offer support from the Battle.net team. Anyone who is looking forward to getting this game can do so on August 15. As of right now, the prices for the United States will cost around $15, and in Australia will cost around $22. In addition to purchasing the game, you will receive the Brood War expansion as a bonus and thank you from the Blizzard team. [i][size=x-small][url=http://www.pcgamer.com/starcraft-remastered-will-release-this-august-for-15/]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]Infinite Warfare's New Proteus Rifle Accidentally Included an Aimbot[/color][/b] 
Imagine being able to kill an opponent with the touch of a button. Well, recently you had the chance to do that before the Proteus Rifle was nerfed. Developers for Infinite Warfare recently released a new gun called the Proteus Rifle. Those who used the gun had the chance to instantly one-hit kill opponents without even having to aim their reticle on the enemy. You did not even have to aim down the sights either. As long as they were in a close radius, you had the chance to pull the trigger button and instantly obliterate them. Thankfully the bug was fixed, and gameplay is back to normal, but this caused a huge ruckus, and countless amount of videos were made showcasing how overpowered the gun actually was. If you would like to see a short clip of it in action, you can do so by clicking [url=https://youtu.be/-OC8zWEGp5A]here[/url]. [i][size=x-small][url=http://www.pcgamer.com/infinity-warfares-new-proteus-rifle-accidentally-included-an-aimbot/]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]Zelda: Breath Of The Wild's First DLC Pack Out Now[/color][/b] 
The well awaited first DLC for the most popular game on the Nintendo Switch is finally out. Titled, "The Master Trials",  offers a more difficult version of Zelda: Breath Of The Wild. The DLC expansion pack is available for both the Switch and the Wii U and can be purchased for $20. The expansion will take up 456 MB so please be aware if you do not have enough space on your system. Not only does the game bring a harder game mode for players to test their true strength, but the expansion includes some interesting new costumes for Link to wear. One of the weird costumes you can equip is the Tingle Outfit. Yep. You read that right. You probably did not expect that. If you are unaware of what that looks like, or interested in how to find it (must have DLC to obtain it) then check it out [url=http://www.gamesradar.com/heres-how-to-find-zelda-breath-of-the-wilds-dlc-tingle-outfit/#]here[/url]! [i][size=x-small][url=https://www.gamespot.com/articles/zelda-breath-of-the-wilds-first-dlc-pack-out-now/1100-6451308/]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]Massive Xbox Digital Sale Begins, All Deals Revealed[/color][/b] 
Just like the famous Summer Steam sale, Xbox will be having a sale as well. The sale will be offering discounted games on many popular titles and is available for both Xbox systems. The Xbox mega-discount sale started on June 30 and those with an Xbox Live Gold Membership, you have the chance to get up to 70% percent off certain titles. If you are not a Gold Member, do not feel left out as you will have the chance to get games off for 60%, Here are a list of games being offered (Thanks and credits to Gamespot for the list):
[list]
[*]Battlefield 1 ($30)
[*]BioShock: The Collection ($36)
[*]Call of Duty: Black Ops III Gold Edition ($36)
[*]Dark Souls III ($30)
[*]Dead Rising 4 ($36)
[*]Deus Ex: Human Revolution ($19.80). 
[*]Fallout 4 ($22.50), Far Cry 4 ($20)
[*]For Honor ($42)
[*]Gears of War 4 ($30)
[*]Halo 5: Guardians ($20)
[*]Madden NFL 17 ($13.20)
[*]Mafia III ($30)
[*]Resident Evil 7 ($42)
[*]Steep ($36)
[*]The Witcher 3: Complete Edition ($30)[/list] [i][size=x-small][url=https://www.gamespot.com/articles/massive-xbox-digital-sale-begins-all-deals-reveale/1100-6451333/]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[align=center]Gaming Video of the Week[sp]

[yt]https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=PN4gEchJtY4[/yt][/sp][/align]

[color=transparent]       [/color]

[align=center][img]https://i.imgur.com/ctcHVCW.png[/img][/align]

[b][color=white]Windows 10 to Get Built-in Protection Against Most Ransomware Attacks[/color][/b] 
The rise of ransomware the past year is at an all-time high. Luckily for those who have the Windows 10 OS, soon enough you will have the chance to have a built-in ransomware protection option for your computer. Windows will soon be introducing a new security option that users can tick that will protect all of your files and folders. This new protection will stop unauthorized changes from unfriendly programs. If needed, you will have the chance to whitelist certain programs and folders you also have the option to do that as well. WannaCry and Petya are attacking computers all across the globe and in the month that these two have seen the limelight they have done nothing but caused chaos for people. Microsoft is not unaware of the situation going on now, and they are trying their best to come up with solutions to patch this ransomware and the introduction of this new anti-ransomware feature it may be the start of it. [i][size=x-small][url=http://thehackernews.com/2017/06/windows10-controlled-folder-access-ransomware-protection.html]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]Wikileaks Reveals CIA Malware that Hacks & Spy On Linux Computers[/color][/b] 
WikiLeaks has revealed another malware that the CIA is using. The name of it was titled OutlawCountry, and it allowed the United States Central Intelligence Agency (CIA) to target those who are currently running on the Linux operating system. The purpose of OutlawCountry was to redirect outbound network traffic. The tool has a kernel module which allows the CIA hackers to load a shell onto the target system. Once loaded onto the system, it creates a hidden file on the computer with a name that would be hard to find or has no relevance to the user itself. Those who analyzed the program say that these hackers rely on exploits and backdoors in order to inject the software onto the system. This is not the only leaked hacking tool that the CIA has been using. Since the month of March, there have been over 14 different leaks. How many more of Vault 7's leaks will there be? [i][size=x-small][url=http://thehackernews.com/2017/06/cia-linux-hacking-tool-malware.html]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]Man Phished His Way into Stealing Bitcoin from Dark Web Criminals[/color][/b] 
Not too often do you hear the term phishing? When you do, it is normally never for good. Whether you look at this man as a hero or cyber-criminal is completely up to you. The 35-year-old tech fanatic Michael Richo was recently arrested for a phishing con he recently took part in. His skill in the art allowed him to steal Bitcoin from criminals on the dark web. The way he was able to pull off this master scam was by running a popular website on the dark web. The website served as a marketplace where people were allowed to sell their illegal products anonymously. You are going to laugh after hearing how he was able to get all this Bitcoin. Of course being an admin on the website he had access to all the user information. After doing research on some of the members, who simply would try and log into the account one by one until he was successful. Another method he used to get member information was linking fake links that redirected to the forum but turned out to be phony. The fake login page was hosted on his PC at home, and it looked exactly like the real website. Those who were silly enough to sign into the fake website had their information stolen, and over $365,000 was made. Richo is awaiting his sentencing which will be taking place this September, and he is looking to get up to 30 years in prison. [i][size=x-small][url=https://latesthackingnews.com/2017/07/02/20958/]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[color=transparent]   [/color][/size][/font]

[font=Trebuchet MS][size=1][color=transparent]       [/color]

[align=center][img]http://www.hackforums.news/assets/v3/3-301.png[/img][/align]

[color=transparent]       [/color]
